title: How I Love Myself During a Depressive Episode

content: Having self-love when you’re going through a depressive episode is very difficult. You’re in survival mode -- doing whatever you can to make it through the day. I feel like I’m in a fog and loving myself is not a part of that fog.

Self-love isn’t a priority of mine when I’m depressed. Not only is it not a priority of mine, but it seems unattainable. Depression sucks up all of the emotions that I have for life and myself and puts a storm cloud over them.
Separate yourself from your depression; it is not you.

YOU are not “lazy.” Your depression takes all of your energy . I’m not saying to use your depression to make excuses for yourself, but it’s important not to blame yourself for something that’s a symptom of your depression.

Keeping your identity separate from your depression makes it a lot easier to love yourself. You are still you. All the things about you that make you special are still there even when you’re depressed. Don’t forget that.

sections.heading: Don’t focus on how your loved ones will view you during a depressive episode.
content: The real loved ones in your life will stick around through the ups and downs of your depression.

Know that even though it feels like this time may never pass, it will. If you can’t fully love yourself in the depressive episode you’re in, know that there will come a time when you love yourself again. It may seem impossibly far in the future, but it will come. So if your self-love journey isn’t going too well right now, it will get better.

When in a depressive episode, having someone show you love makes a significant difference. Love and affection can feel so foreign when you’re depressed. Sometimes we don’t have someone at that moment to show us compassion and love.
This may seem like a laughable suggestion if you are in the middle of depression, but if there’s any way you can be that “hug” you need for yourself, do it.

sections.heading: Pick three positive affirmations and say them to yourself aloud every day.
content: Tell yourself them and don’t just brush off the compliment -- believe it. Pay attention to the times your negative self-talk is the worst. Write some positive affirmations on sticky notes and leave them in places you would benefit from the most.

Is it when you're getting undressed to get in the shower? Stick some on your bathroom mirror. Is it while you’re scrolling on social media? Put a timer on your social media after a certain amount of time and include a positive affirmation.

You can work in little self-love reminders into your daily routine. These little reminders throughout your day can be beneficial if you don’t feel like you have enough time to include self-care in your day.

Loving yourself when you’re depressed is possible. If you can’t tell yourself that you love yourself right now, then know I love you. Also, if you know anyone that struggles with depression, tell them you love them today, (or every day).
